data.title: Recognise these faces? Here’s 13 actors before they were stars
data.meta_description: It’s a long way to the top in Hollywood, here’s some stars when they were just heading there.
data.text:
Watch 24 Hour Party People here: https://www.stan.com.au/watch/24-hour-party-people-2002

Courteney Cox– Scream

While Friends was still in the early stages of becoming a global sensation, Courteney Cox (who memorably got ger break dancing in a Bruce Springsteen video clip) look time out from the comedy circuit to play a hungry reporter in the horror film Scream. Her character helped catch the killer and reappeared in multiple sequels.

Watch Scream here: https://www.stan.com.au/watch/scream-1996

Seth Green – It

Instantly recognised as the hilarious son of Doctor Evil in the Austin Powers movies and famed as the creator of the Robot Chicken series, Seth Green’s start in stardom came a world away from comedy, as “Trashmouth” Tozier, a brave but often reckless kid who fights evil clown Pennywise in the original miniseries of Stephen King’s story It.

Watch Stephen King’s It here: https://www.stan.com.au/watch/stephen-kings-it-1990

Hugh Jackman – Paperback Hero

Forget Wolverine or The World’s Greatest Showman, before Hollywood found Hugh Jackman he was making his way in low-budget Australian films such as the comedy Paperback Hero, where he played a rough outback truck driver who isn’t afraid of anything… except admitting he’s also the secret author of a best-selling romantic novel.

Watch Paperback Hero here: https://www.stan.com.au/watch/paperback-hero-1999

Kevin Smith – Clerks

These days he’s one of Hollywood’s biggest independent directors and producers now with a string of hits under his belt, but when he was first starting out, Kevin Smith had to use every trick he could to get his first big project made – including starring in it himself. He gave himself a few breaks however by making sure his character Silent Bob had nothing to say.

Watch Clerks here: https://www.stan.com.au/watch/clerks-1994

Jake Gyllenhall – City Slickers

A movie about three men who try to break free of mid-life crisis by heading out on a cattle drive, City Slickers shot Billy Crystal into the spotlight. And it didn’t hurt the career of the young actor who played his son either – that would be Gyllenhaal in his first role. He wasn’t exactly proud of his boring dad to start off with, but by the end of the film, he loved what he had become.

Watch City Slickers here: https://www.stan.com.au/watch/city-slickers-1991

Jack Black – Bio-Dome

In School of Rock, Jumanji and King Fu Panda, comic actor Jack Black has won fans around the world for his unique ability to find the laughs in any situation. Back in 1996 however, he was still best known as one half of singing act Tenacious D when he appeared (very briefly) in this film about two friends trapped in a futuristic ecology experiment.

Watch Bio-Dome here: https://www.stan.com.au/watch/bio-dome-1996

Kim Cattrall – Mannequin

As Sex and The City’s Samantha, Kim Cattrall is known as the friend of Carrie (Sarah Jessica Parker) who romances a string of men and In The Black List, Spader is the superspy out to redeem himself. Here however, she plays an ancient Egyptian reborn as a shop dummy and he is the boss of the man who falls in love with her. Yes, you read that right.

Watch Mannequin here: https://www.stan.com.au/watch/mannequin-1987

Tom Hardy – Black Hawk Down

In the Spider-Man spinoff Venom, Tom Hardy has taken a villain to centre stage, showing that just because you’re joined with an alien parasite and sporting deadly fangs, doesn’t mean you can be the star. Years before however he was just another soldier in the background of this action-packed story of American troops trapped behind enemy lines in Africa.

Watch Black Hawk Down here: https://www.stan.com.au/watch/black-hawk-down-2001

Jim Parsons – Garden State

To Big Bang Theory fans, Parsons is (and will forever be) Dr Sheldon Cooper, the super-genius with all the people skills of a houseplant who somehow manages to find love in spite of himself. He’s a lot more down to earth here as Tim, who makes a living dressing up as a knight at a medieval theme park and has fallen in love with the mother of a friend.

Watch Garden State Here: https://www.stan.com.au/watch/garden-state-2004

Matt Bomer – Texas Chainsaw Massacre: The Beginning

Handsome, a former American football star and charming as Ken “Doll” – The Perfect Man in the male stripper comedy Magic Mike, Matt Bomer has become Hollywood’s go-to guy when they need a romantic lead. In Texas Chainsaw Massacre: The Beginning however he had another role – he was the victim of a chainsaw-wielding maniac.

Watch Texas Chainsaw Massacre: The Beginning here: https://www.stan.com.au/watch/the-texas-chainsaw-massacre-the-beginning-2008

Keen to play Spot The Star some more? Check out these movies and more here: https://www.stan.com.au/watch/movies
